coded_answer.p: I've recievedreceived your letter asking me for further information about the conference that you goingare going to organise very soon, here. Here yoyou have a little help for it.

At firstFirst, I'd like to tell you that the hotel where you goingare going to stay is "The Palace Hotel", wichwhich is situated at the centercentre of the town. It can't be difficult to find, because it is very near ofto the conference. Also there is a bus provided forby the organisation to take all the students atto the hotel. At the end of the conference itthere will be a party. I might suggest you to wearwear a casual dressoutfit, because many students feelsfeel like relaxing after thea whole day sitting and listening allat the conference. The party iswill be amazed by a group of musicians, and as I rememberedremember from last year it was unforgivenunforgettable, because all the people wherewere dancing and having a lot of fun.

It is a well-situated town with a lot of museums to visit, especially "the History museumMuseum", wichwhich I visited last year, and I think you canwill enjoy it as well. It doesn't take a lot of time to visit and the entrance is free.
WhisingWishingHoping I've been very helpful to you.
THE TELEPHONE CHANGECHANGESHAS CHANGED OUR LIFESLIVES

It's imposibleimpossible NowdaysNowadaysnowadays to thinkimagine a life without that invention how quickly affects our life especially in business. We can't imagine a big company without a phone, thatwhich can makesmake business more quicklyquick than anything else.

Also, I washave been asking too manya lot of people in the street.: Could you live without a telephone? The answer was allalways the same: "ImposibleImpossible". An old woman told me how important was the phonethe phone was when her only son was abroad studingstudying computers inat the "Chicago University", she. She told me that every night she was expectingexpected a call from her son, forbecause her was the line of the hapinesshappiness.

However, itthere was one personeperson wichwhichwho he told me, ithe wasn't happy at all with the phone, because he used to writtewrite a lot, especially at Christmas when he wanted to wish all his friends a very nice Christmas but now everybody phonephones him, losingending a very old fashiontradition.
In my opinion this little "box" that everybody has at home can safesave your life, especially if you need to ring a doctor in an emergency situation.
In conclusion don't make a very long phone calls and you won't have to pay a very expensive bill.
